events.title: Inside the Gaza tunnels that Israel says must be destroyed before reconstruction can begin
events.summary: Underneath the Shujaiya neighborhood in Gaza City, the Israel Defense Forces are clearing Hamas tunnels used by the militant group.

events.title: A MAGA-aligned party could be on the verge of an electoral earthquake in the U.K.
events.summary: This market town on England’s south coast is not usually associated with political upheaval, having voted for the traditional establishment Conservative Party at every election since 1885.

events.title: Comedy in Russia is booming. But stand-ups live in fear of being jailed for jokes.
events.summary: Stand-up comedy is booming in President Vladimir Putin's Russia but comics have to tread a fine line with their jokes where some have been jailed.

events.title: From the rubble, the show must go on for one of Gaza's surviving radio stations
events.summary: Dr. Rami al-Ashrafi opens his radio show the way countless presenters do around the world, but Zaman FM operates like few others.

events.title: These Americans have 'no plans to leave Mexico’ following cartel violence
events.summary: Americans living in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico who witnessed the violence following the death of cartel leader Nemesio Ruben Oseguera Cervantes said they feel safe and describe why the country has become home to them.

events.title: Cuban officials: Multiple killed after armed confrontation in Cuba's waters
events.summary: Cuban officials say four people were killed and six were injured after a U.S.-registered speedboat violated territorial waters and sparked an armed conflict. NBC News' Gabe Gutierrez and Jose Diaz-Balart report on what officials are saying and tense U.S.-Cuba relations.

events.title: Video shows compound where Mexican cartel leader was killed
events.summary: New video shows the inside of the compound in Tapalpa, Mexico, where authorities located and killed drug cartel leader Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, also known as "El Mencho." NBC News’ George Solis reports on the state of the country amid the violence carried out by cartel members furious over the killing.

events.title: What to know about Elon Musk and China with Tesla's massive 'Gigafactory' in Shanghai
events.summary: Billionaire tech executive Elon Musk’s relationship with party leaders in China is in the spotlight as the trade war ramps up. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on what this means for his popularity in the country.

events.title: Trump said he 'obliterated' Iran's nuclear program. Now he says the U.S. may have to bomb Iran again.
events.summary: President Donald Trump said that Iran's nuclear program was "obliterated" last summer, but he now says the U.S. may have to bomb Iran again over its nuclear ambitions.

events.title: These Americans call Mexico home — and still feel safe despite recent cartel violence
events.summary: Americans who live in Puerto Vallarta said that despite the recent violence following a cartel leader's killing, it's much safer than people in the U.S. think.

events.title: Louvre museum director resigns four months after jewelry heist
events.summary: Four months after France was stunned by a brazen daylight heist where thieves snatched jewels worth approximately $102 million from Paris' Louvre Museum, the home of the “Mona Lisa” has a new boss.

events.title: France demands U.S. Ambassador explain no-show as Trump's diplomats anger Europe
events.summary: U.S. Ambassador Charles Kushner has been banned from meeting French officials after snubbing a meeting over comments about the death of far-right activist Quentin Deranque.

events.title: Zelenskyy's public frustration grows as Putin's war enters a 5th year
events.summary: Volodymyr Zelenskyy is increasingly angry with peace talks as Vladimir Putin's invasion reached its four-year anniversary Tuesday.

events.title: Ex-British ambassador to the U.S. released on bail after arrest in Epstein investigation
events.summary: Britain's former ambassador to the U.S. has been released on bail after having been arrested following weeks of revelations over his relationship with late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Videos from Puerto Vallarta show smoke, flames and chaos after killing of Jalisco drug kingpin
events.summary: Smoke filled the sky as the swanky beach town of Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, erupted into chaos Sunday after the government killed a drug kingpin.

events.title: Cartel leader's romantic partner helped lead to his capture, Mexican officials say
events.summary: Authorities used the location of a woman who was with Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, the drug kingpin known as "El Mencho," to find him.

events.title: FBI head Kash Patel celebrates with men's hockey team amid major probes in U.S.
events.summary: FBI Director Kash Patel chugged beer and sprayed it over members of the American men’s hockey team following their gold medal win in Italy on Sunday.

events.title: Powerful cartel unleashes wave of violence across Mexico after its leader's killing
events.summary: Mexican forces killed Nemesio “El Mencho” Oseguera Cervantes, leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, sparking violence and roadblocks across Jalisco.

events.title: Iran hit by resurgent protests as U.S. builds pressure ahead of new nuclear talks
events.summary: Iran was jolted by resurgent anti-government protests over the weekend, as Washington sought to build pressure on Tehran to accede to its demands ahead of new nuclear talks amid a massive American military buildup

events.title: A familiar uncertainty as the world grapples with fresh Trump tariff turmoil
events.summary: U.S. allies across Europe voiced alarm and frustration after President Donald Trump said Saturday that he was hiking his newly announced global tariff to 15%, less than a day after announcing a 10% worldwide duty

events.title: British government considers removing former Prince Andrew from the royal line of succession
events.summary: The British government is considering formally removing Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor from the royal line of succession once the police investigation into allegations of misconduct in public office has concluded, a source familiar with the deliberations told NBC News

events.title: India's AI summit draws global leaders, big pledges and some chaos
events.summary: As the U.S. and China battle to dominate artificial intelligence, India has attempted to highlight that there are other pathways to navigate the silicon surge.
